intro: Crotalaria intermedia var. dorumaensis, commonly known as the Dorumaensis Crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Its seeds are encased in hairy, pod-like structures that aid in seed dispersal.
